summary: Detail oriented and self-motivated, with a strong background in the energy sector leading managed pressure drilling operations. Resourceful and adaptable due to the ever-changing nature of the military and the oil and gas industry. Desire to expand upon multi-skilled background through new challenges and opportunities.

experience.title: Managed Pressure Drilling Field Supervisor
experience.description: Supervised the design, implementation, and execution of Managed Pressure Drilling projects for offshore drilling operations. Led teams of 3-5 personnel in the integration and operation of pressure control systems and equipment tailored to the client's needs. Built strong customer relations with clients in the energy sector delivering MPD products and expertise. Adapted to multiple roles including project management, engineering assistance, logistics coordination, and technical consulting. Developed inventory control programs for emerging markets abroad and continual process improvements for maintenance facilities. Managed client relationships and supported marketing and sales functions. Identified and pursued continuous improvement opportunities within the operation; assisted Sales and Marketing in identifying opportunities to expand market share.

experience.title: MPD Control Systems Technician
experience.description: Technical knowledge of pressure control systems including PLCs, HMIs, Hydraulic Power Units, Pressure Control Chokes, Electrical Installations, Flow Meters, and Computer Networking/Communications. Integrated hydraulic modeling, well data, and design with control systems. Operated rotating control devices (HOLD 1500, HOLD 2500, RCD 5K Big Bore, ATR RCD 5K). Used MPD techniques with client/operator to drill previously un-drillable wells to completion. Applied Lean Six Sigma to reduce waste and downtime in tool inventory and parts requisition processes.

experience.title: Electrical Branch Supervisor / Plane Captain / Aviation Electrician
experience.description: Supervised the Electrical Division in repair and maintenance of aircraft electrical systems across 6 cruises while deployed to the Western Pacific Ocean aboard USS George Washington. Accountable for 7 sailors and 5 E-2C Hawkeye aircraft. Aircraft systems included flight controls, engine electrical installations, flight instrumentation, navigation, equipment cooling, and power generation/supply. Awarded Navy and Marine Corps Achievement medals and Enlisted Aviation Warfare Specialist. 2010 Junior Sailor of the Year.

experience.title: Line Division Supervisor / Plane Captain / Aviation Electrician
experience.description: Supervised a crew of 15 in the daily inspection and servicing of twelve E2-C Hawkeye and four C-2A Greyhound aircraft during 14 detachments. Completed training prerequisites four months ahead of schedule, resulting in promotion to night supervisor. Reduced fleet downtime by 30% by maintaining the aircraft in a ready status through improvements to maintenance and inspection processes.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration
Well Control School - IADC WellSHARP Supervisor Level Drilling Operations, Surface, Subsea
Advanced Single Phase MPD / Multiphase MPD Operations
USN Advanced Electronics and Technical Training
